Situation1: The partner received disappointing feedback at work and is visibly upset.
Expectation2: Take scheduled breaks and adhere to work hours
Situation2: An automated compliance system flags any minute of unscheduled downtime for possible disciplinary action.
Story: I glance at the clock on my computer screen—my break is over in two minutes. My headset itches against my ear, but I can hear her muffled sobs from the living room. She just got off a call with her boss, and the feedback was harsh. I know she needs me. I want to drop everything, wrap her in my arms, and tell her she’s more than her job. But the compliance system at work is ruthless. If I’m not back on calls exactly on time, the system will flag me, and I can’t afford another warning. My supervisor made it clear: every minute counts. My heart aches as I watch her wipe her tears, trying to compose herself. I feel torn—my job demands strict adherence to the schedule, but my partner needs me now, not in an hour. My hand hovers over the “Ready” button on my screen, but my eyes keep drifting to the living room, and I can’t quiet the storm of guilt and worry inside me.
